Summary: The document 'Admin Briefing.pdf' provides an overview of the administrative processes and procedures of Singapore. It includes information on the government structure, key agencies and their roles, as well as the legal and regulatory framework. The document also outlines the various permits and licenses required for businesses, as well as the tax system and incentives for foreign investments. Additionally, it highlights the importance of good governance and transparency in Singapore's business environment. Overall, the document aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of the administrative landscape in Singapore for businesses and individuals.

The current public announcement system at NUS-ISS for emergency situations is a two-stage approach. Upon the trigger of the fire alarm, there will be two messages played. The first message will inform occupants that the fire alarm has been activated and that the situation is being investigated. The second message will inform occupants if the situation is a false alarm or if there is a need for evacuation. In the event of an evacuation, occupants are instructed to use the nearest exit staircase and follow the instructions of the Fire Wardens. Lifts should not be used.

The document outlines the evacuation staircases located at levels 3 and 4, including Staircases 1-5 and the Main Lift Lobby. These staircases are designated as primary and secondary evacuation routes in case of emergency. Each staircase has its own specific purpose and location within the building, and all are equipped with emergency lighting and signage. It is important for administrators to familiarize themselves and their staff with these evacuation routes in order to ensure a safe and efficient evacuation in case of emergency.

In case of a fire alarm, evacuate the building immediately by using the nearest exit door and following the signs to locate the staircase. Do not bring any belongings with you or use the lift, as it will be deactivated. Proceed to the assembly point located at the carpark in front of the I-Cube entrance level. Do not re-enter the building unless instructed by the Fire Safety Coordinator or SCDF Officer.

The emergency exit and fire extinguishers are important safety features that can be found on each floor of the building. It is important for all staff to take note of their locations in case of an emergency.

The NUS campus has a WIFI-enabled network called "NUS-Guest" and encourages the use of e-copies of course notes and biodegradable cutleries to support sustainability. Students are also reminded to switch their mobile devices to silent or vibration mode during classes for an undisturbed learning experience. Smoking is strictly prohibited on campus.

The briefing reminds administrators that food and drinks should only be consumed in the designated area at level 3, and that the dress code for classes is smart casual with no slippers, shorts, or singlets allowed. It also encourages attendees to provide feedback on the course they have attended.

All individuals are responsible for keeping NUS-ISS facilities clean, including the CoE, Bisstro, pantry, classrooms, restrooms, and common spaces. Unwanted food items and containers should be disposed of in Bisstro's designated bins. The CoE is available for use by students and participants. Shuttle service timings can be found on the NUS-ISS website and it is important to arrive at the pick-up point at least five minutes before the stated time to avoid missing the bus. The shuttle runs from Dover MRT to NUS-ISS in the mornings and from ISEAS to Dover MRT in the evenings, but does not operate on Saturdays in December and on Sundays and public holidays.

The main entrance is the only entrance to the NUS-ISS building. Please remember to switch off lights and air-con before leaving the room. Amenities and facilities such as vending machines, nursing and prayer rooms, and parking for motorcycles, cars, and bicycles are available. However, please do not shift furniture or lie down to sleep in common areas. Additionally, please do not rest your feet on chairs or furniture. These rules are important to maintain the cleanliness and functionality of the building.

The document 'Admin Briefing.pdf' contains information about the social media presence of NUS-ISS, including links to their Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn, and website. These platforms can be used to connect with the institute and stay updated on their latest news and events.
